intro: Gnaphalium moelleri, commonly known as the velvetleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to brown flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its foliage is covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Gnaphalium moelleri is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
